project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, any Dropdown in JIRA menu navigation did not work using when trying to choose any options using "Arrow Keys"
h3. Suggested Solution

To have JAWS officially supported for JIRA to help the navigation solely on a keyboard.
h3. Why this is important

JAWS is one of the common screen reader software to be used.
fields.summary: Accessibility: Official Support for JAWS Screen Reader

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing Project Name does not reflect on the Customer Portal view.

After reindexing the instance, the Customer Portal still shows the old project name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the new JSM 4.15
 # Create a project
 # Rename the Project and wait for the reindex process to complete.
 # Go to the customer portal
 # The old name will still be showing.

h3. Expected Results

The Portal should show the new Project Name
h3. Actual Results

The old Project Name is still showing up.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing Project Name does not reflect on the Customer Portal view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be very nice to have a configuration to display object attributes as soon as we select an insight object from the custom field in the Create issue screen. 

We have a very similar configuration for the issueview screen. (please see the attached screenshot)

If we can have such a configuration for a create screen, that would be nice.
fields.summary: Display object attributes on Issue Create Screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently when adding a customer to a project via the "Add customers" button in the Customers page, there's no indication of users already created in Jira which can lead to new users being created incorrectly due to a typo when entering the user's email address or a user being created with the e-mail address as their username before a User Directory sync had the time to create the proper user from LDAP.

It would be great if the "Add customers" feature would use the Browse Users global permission and show a list of users and/or show a warning when a new user is going to be created.
fields.summary: Autocomplete/suggest users when adding customers to project

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In Jira Service Management, customers sometimes need to create multiple requests that are similar in nature. Under these circumstances, it would be nice if they had the ability to clone the issue being created a certain number of times.

Currently, customers do not have the ability to clone issues, Jira Service Management agents can perform this task by using the *Clone* option. However, implementing this feature would generate a lot of value for customers using Jira Service Management through the customer portal.
fields.summary: Allow cloning of issues by customers during issue creation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'Show Х more links' link doesn't work in custom reports issue view in a Jira service management project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Jira service management project, have an issue with more issue links
  !screenshot-2 (4).png|thumbnail! 
 # Navigate to Reports in the project settings sidebar
 # Create a custom report, edit the filter to pick the above issue
 !screenshot-3 (2).png|thumbnail! 
 # Save the Report
 # Click on the above issue in the report window
 # Click on the 'Show Х more links' (which doesn't work)
 !screenshot-4 (2).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

'Show Х more links' link should work in custom reports issue view as it does from the queue or search 'linked issues'
h3. Actual Results

'Show Х more links' link is unresponsive and doesn't work in custom reports issue view
h3. Workaround

Open the same ticket using instead the URL <JIRA_BASE_URL>/browse/<ISSUE_KEY>.
The "show X more links" button will work from this URL.
fields.summary: 'Show Х more links' link doesn't work in custom reports issue view in a Jira service management project

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As JSM Data Center users we need the "Set Up Deployment Tracking" functionality as it was already implemented for Cloud JSM (https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/set-up-deployment-tracking/) for the Data Center solution as well, to track the deployments also in an on-premise environments.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * Jenkins can be connected to JSM DataCenter as described in [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/set-up-deployment-tracking/]

Thanks in advance for considering this suggestion.
fields.summary: Set Up Deployment Tracking also for JSM Data Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Service Management (JSM) [4.15.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-15-x-release-notes-1043891577.html] has an upgrade task named {{AUT_0014_FixSearchTemplateOnChangeDates}} which targets two _Custom Fields_ from the _IT service management_ project template:
 * Change completion date
 * Change start date

\\
\\
If a project was created using this template and one of these custom fields were deleted, then the upgrade task will fail.
The upgrade will still continue and complete, but every time the instance is restarted, Jira will try to run the upgrade task, which would continue to fail.
\\
\\
If upgrading Jira Data Center using the [Zero Downtime|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/zero-downtime-upgrades-for-jira-data-center-applications/] feature, then you won't be able to leave the upgrade mode while the upgrade task fails.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a fresh instance of Jira Service Management on version _4.14.0_.
 # Create a sample project using the _IT service management_ template.
 # Go to the _Custom fields_ administration page and delete the following custom fields.
  #* _Change completion date_
  #* _Change start date_
 # Upgrade Jira Service Management to version _4.15.0_.
 # Start Jira after the upgrade so it runs the upgrade tasks.

h3. Expected Results
The upgrade completes successfully without any error.
{{AUT_0014_FixSearchTemplateOnChangeDates}} detects the custom fields don't exist, although the project template is in use, and deals gracefully with it.

h3. Actual Results
The upgrade completes, but the {{AUT_0014_FixSearchTemplateOnChangeDates}} upgrade task fails.
The following is logged in the application log ({{atlassian-jira.log}}):

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Android users are not able to access Jira Service Management projects and issues on the mobile app after upgrading Jira to 4.15

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install or upgrade to Jira Service Management 4.15.
# Ensure the Mobile Plugin for Jira version is 3.2.0.
# Install the [Jira Server app from Play Store|https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.atlassian.jira.server], the latest version is 0.16.2.
# Log in to the Jira instance, try to search for a JSM project you have access to, or browse any JSM issues. 

h3. Expected Results
For both iOS and Android users,
* JSM projects appear in the Recently viewed tab
* JSM projects are searchable
* JSM issues are viewable, like this
 !image-2021-02-19-15-45-56-411.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
(!) This affects only Android users
* JSM projects do not appear in the Recently viewed tab
* JSM projects are not searchable
* JSM issues are not viewable with a message "_At this time, our mobile app doesn't support Jira Service Management projects_", like this
 !image-2021-02-19-15-46-34-359.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Downgrade the mobile plugin with the steps below.
# Stop Jira.
# Remove jira-mobile-rest-3.2.0.jar from <Jira_Installation_directory/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins.
# Put  [^jira-mobile-rest-3.1.0.jar] into <Jira_Home_directory/plugins/installed-plugins folder or upload the add-on via the Manage add-ons page after Jira started. The plugin can also be downloaded from [this link|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220151/mobile-plugin-for-jira/version-history].
# Start Jira.
# Go to _<Jira_URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa_ and add the dark feature below.
#* com.atlassian.jira.jsd.mobile
# Ask your users to log out from the mobile app, and log in again.

h3. Notes
This is also affecting users who are on Jira version lower than 4.15 but Mobile Plugin for Jira version 3.2.0. This can be worked around also with downgrading the Mobile Plugin for Jira version to 3.1.0.
fields.summary: Android users are not able to access JSM projects and issues on the mobile app after updating Mobile Plugin for Jira

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It seems that JSM is not currently RFC6750 compliant, as the WWW-Authenticate does not return the [expected values|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750#section-6.1.1]; this makes coding and debugging integrations with OAuth difficult. Are we able to put this in the roadmap?
fields.summary: Make Jira Service Management RFC 7650 Compliant

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A Users having User Role for a Schema, may be able to guess/deduct the Label of Objects they do not have permission to view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User A has a User Role on a Schema
 # Configure 2 Object Types: OTA and OTB
 # Set up the reference from OTA to OTB (optional - you can configure this Attribute to be Hidden as well)
 # Set the OTB Configuration>Roles to make sure that User A does not have any role to even view this Object Type
 # Create Objects in both Object Type, e.g.an Object in OTA called MyApplication referencing an Object in OTB with Label="Top Secret"
 # Log in as User A and navigate to OTA and click for Advance Object Search (or navigate to Insight>Search for Objects) and search for the following IQL:
"object HAVING outR(Label = "Top Secrete")

h3. Expected Results

No Results are found, as the Object Labeled "Top Secrete" is not accessible for User A
h3. Actual Results

The object "MyApplication" is shown in the Search result, confirming that THER IS a Hidden Object referenced, labeled "Top Secrete" ...
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight Permissions for Object Type to be enforced in IQL

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
A large amount of execution and database reads from a pretty expensive SQL query, causing database performance issues:
{code:sql}
select `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CLAIMANT`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CLAIMANT_TIME`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CLAIM_COUNT`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CONTENT_TYPE`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CREATED_TIME`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`EXPIRY_TIME`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`ID`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`MSG_DATA`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`MSG_ID`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`MSG_LENGTH`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`PRIORITY`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`QUEUE_ID`, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`VERSION` from `AO_319474_MESSAGE` `AO_319474_MESSAGE` where `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`QUEUE_ID` = 213135 and (`AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CLAIMANT` is null or `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CLAIMANT` is not null and (`AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CLAIMANT_TIME` is null or `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CLAIMANT_TIME` < 1613660280853)) order by `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`PRIORITY` desc, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`CREATED_TIME` asc, `AO_319474_MESSAGE`.`ID` asc limit 1
{code}
Problem mentioned on [JSDSERVER-5736|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5736].

h3. Request
Give the possibility to decrease the query/message count from Jira to the database or remove these logs avoiding database high usage
fields.summary: High number of SdOffThreadEventJobRunner threads on thread dumps connecting to the database

On Jira Cloud, the Processing log contains useful details that are lacking on Jira Data Center, such as how the incoming mails are being processed and the number of the tickets created or updated by these e-mails. It would be a nice feature to have this functionality on Jira Data Center as well.

Below is a picture of how the Processing Log looks like on Jira Cloud:
 !mail processing log - After.png|width=419,height=270!
fields.summary: Improve the Processing log for incoming mails

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

UI problem with the new rich text editor feature for the {{Customer portal}} in JSM 4.15.
 
The focus of the cursor is switched from summary to description when the issue creation page loads. This happens even while typing in the field "Summary".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the new JSM 4.15
 # Go to the customer portal
 # Log in and try to create any test issue.

h3. Expected Results

The cursor focus should be on the  field "Summary"
h3. Actual Results

The {{summary}} field will be skipped/greyed out at first and the cursor focus will be immediately switched to the {{Description}} field. 

Please refer to the attached screen recording.
[^JSM_4.15_CustomerPortal.mov]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: UI problem with the new rich text editor feature for the Customer portal in JSM 4.15

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On Jira Service Management (former Jira Service Desk), comments in issues are either public or internal -- see [Editing and collaborating on issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/editing-and-collaborating-on-issues-939937207.html] for further details.

If an issue from a Service Management Project needs to be moved to a project of a different type, such as Software or Business, then all comments in that issue are made public, including internal comments which may not be ideal.


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice to have an option on the [Move Issue wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/moving-an-issue-939937218.html] to associate internal comments to a role in the target project, keeping these comments restricted.
 
h3. Workaround 
_Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available_
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to restrict internal comments to a Project role when moving an issue from a Jira Service Management Project to a different Software or Business Project

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Pause* condition of an SLA is not respected if the 3 following conditions are met:
- the SLA is configured with "status A" as a pause condition
- a ticket was transitioned from "status A" to the same "status A"
- the SLA configuration has been updated by adding a new status "status B" as a pause condition

In such case, after the SLA recalculation has completed, the SLA will be ticking in that ticket instead of being paused.

h3. Environment

This bug was replicated in JSD 4.13.0, and reported by a customer in JSD 4.14.1.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a new JSD project
# Edit the default workflow "Service Request Fulfilment workflow for Jira Service Desk", so that any status can be transitioned to the status "Waiting for Support"
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
# Configure the SLA "Time to first Response" to pause when a ticket enters the status "Waiting for Support"
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new ticket of type "Service Request", and verify that the "Time to first Response" is paused (since the ticket entered right away the status "Waiting for Support")
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 
# Wait for a few minutes
# Transition the ticket from the status "Waiting for Support" to "Waiting for Support"
# Verify that the SLA "Time to first Response" is still paused
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 
# Update the SLA configuration by adding an additional status to the pause condition
 !Step5.png|thumbnail! 
# Wait for the SLA recalculation to complete, and go back to the ticket created earlier
# Check the status of the SLA "Time to first Response"

h3. Expected results

The SLA "Time to first Response" should still be paused

h3. Actual results

The SLA "Time to first Response" is now ticking:
 !Step7.png|thumbnail! 

Checking the SLA Audit logs for this ticket, we can see that the SLA should have been paused since its creation time as per the logs:
 !Step6.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h4. Note 1

After updating the SLA configuration, if the ticket is transitioned again to the same status "Waiting for Support", the SLA is paused, but the remaining time of the SLA is incorrect. The SLA assumes that times has passed and that the remaining time does not equal the goal set for this ticket. However, the ticket entered the status "Waiting for Support" since its creation, so the remaining time of the SLA should equal the goal (set to 8h in this example):
 !Step8.png|thumbnail! 

Checking the SLA audit logs, we can now see 2 consecutive "PAUSE" events, and only the most recent one is being taken into consideration for the SLA remaining time:
 !Step9.png|thumbnail! 

Checking the SLA JSON data for that particular ticket, we can see that only the most recent PAUSE event was taken into account, and that the earlier PAUSE events were ignored:
{code}
"timeline": {
    "events": [
        {
            "date": 1613491378030,
            "dateString": "2021-02-16T16:02:58.030Z",
            "types": [
                "START"
            ]
        },
        {
            "date": 1613491790255,
            "dateString": "2021-02-16T16:09:50.255Z",
            "types": [
                "PAUSE"
            ]
        }
    ]
},
{code}


h4. Note 2

This bug seems to be a "cousin" of the existing bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6671

h3. Workaround

No workaround known so far.

Even the SLA reconstruction API call from [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html]  won't fix the SLA.
fields.summary: SLA is ticking after its configuration has been updated while it should be paused

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We are configuring a change control workflow with two separate approval steps.

As an example, we have users that are in two groups, _Group A_ and _Group B_. The first step will require two users within _Group A_ to approve the issue. The second step will require two users within _Group B_ to approve the issue, while preventing users that approved the issue in the first step from approving the issue in the second step.

Currently, there is no method to obtain the users that have previously approved an issue.
h3. Suggested Solution

Based on the {{approved()}} JQL function, we would like to have a function introduced that would only output the user(s) that approved an issue, instead of all users who can approve an issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira service management issue events are processed asynchronously by maintaining a list of events in a queue. But when issue events are generated by a background process, it is calculated directly on the same thread without being queued. This can result in a race condition where a new issue event gets processed before all the existing events are processed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample SLA - "_Time to in progress_" which begins counting when "_Entered Status: Open_" and stops on "_Entered Status: Work in progress_".
 # Create an automation rule in Automation for Jira plugin. When - _Issue created_, Then - _Transition to "Work in progress"_.
 # Create requests using a script and notice SLAs are not calculated on some of the issues.

h3. Expected Results

SLAs are correctly calculated for all issues.
h3. Actual Results

SLAs are not calculated for all issues. There is no error in the log file. 
h3. Workaround

For issues due to automation for Jira plugin - Using automation provided by JSM instead of automation for Jira plugin will result in correct SLAs.

*(!) For all other plugins/async action issues - Disable asynchronous processing by adding the following feature flags. (_Note disabling asynchronous processing will increase time taken for user actions.)_*
 * {{sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled}}
 * {{sd.internal.bounded.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled}}

More details on how to enable/disable a feature flag can be found here - [Enable Dark Feature in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html]
fields.summary: SLA's are not calculated when an issue event is generated by an async process

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Open Request and Closed Request count is "0" in 'Customers' page when switching user profile to a non English language, and if the "Customer Request Type" field has been manually translated for that language.

h3. Note

This bug was replicated in Jira 8.13.0 (Service Desk 4.13.0), but it might also impact older versions too (Jira 7.x / Service Desk 3.x).

h3. Steps to replicate

- Install Jira 8.13.0 with Service Desk 4.13.0
- Go to *⚙ > Issues > Custom Fields*, and note that the *Customer Request Type* is "locked", which means that this field can't be translated
- Follow the steps from the KB [Unlock a locked Jira Software custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unlock-a-locked-jira-software-custom-field-779158866.html] to temporarily unlock the *Customer Request Type* field in the database
- Go back to *⚙ > Issues > Custom Fields*, and note that the *Customer Request Type* is no longer "locked"
- Click on *⚙ > Translate* next to this field, and add a German translation to it
- Create a new Service Desk project
- Create a new customer account in this project
- Create a new Service Desk request in this project and make sure that the Customer Request Type field is set
- Go to the *Project > Customer List* page, and observe that there is 1 opened request for the customer:
 !IssueNotReplicated.png|thumbnail! 
- Now, change your own profile language to German
- Go back to the *Project > Customer List* page

h3. Expected results

We should see the right number of opened requests next to the customer name.

h3. Actual results

The number of opened requests next to this customer is "0"
 !IssueReplicated.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Explanation of the bug

To calculate the number of opened request for a specific customer, the following JQL query is executed in the backend:
{code} 
reporter = "<customer_user_name>" AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = <PROJECT_KEY> AND "Customer Request Type" is not EMPTY
{code}

With the example above, we can see that this query will return 1 result (shown under "Opened Requests"):
 !CorrectJQLQuery.png|thumbnail! 

Because of the bug, if the "Customer Request Type" was manually translated to "bladibla" for example, then the following incorrect JQL query is executed instead (the translated version of this field name is replaced in the JQL query):
{code}
reporter = "<customer_user_name>" AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = <PROJECT_KEY> AND "bladibla" is not EMPTY
{code}

Since this field name is incorrect (the non translated field name should be used instead), no result is returned by this query.


h3. Workaround

The workaround consists in deleting from the Database all the translations of the "Customer Request Type" field:
- Go to *⚙ > Issues > Custom Fields*, and click on *⚙ > View* next to the "Customer Request Type" field
- Note the custom field ID at the end of the URL (secure/admin/ConfigureCustomField!default.jspa?customFieldId=XXXXX)
- Run the following query in the Database to confirm that there is a translation for this field and for the German lang:
{code}
select * from propertyentry where property_key like 'jira.translation.custom.fieldcustomfield%'
{code}
-- You should see a row that includes the custom field ID XXXXX and the corresponding locale (for example, de_DE for German). (!) Note the value from the id column. It will be needed for the DELETE query.
{code}
96602,CustomField,10001,jira.translation.custom.fieldcustomfield_10001.name.de_DE,5
{code}
- (!) *Backup your Jira Database*, so that you can revert changes made to the DB if anything goes wrong
- Run the following query to delete the :
{code}
delete from propertyentry where id = '<id_found_in_the_previous_steps>';
{code}
fields.summary: Opened Request and Closed Request count is "0" in 'Customers' page when switching user profile to a non English language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Service management (Service Desk) only allows to set up this action (Alert user) to alert just Users, needing to add one by one.

h3. Suggested Solution

In some cases, you would like to send the alert to groups. This would provide more flexibility to the automation rules.

h3. Workaround

There is no specific workaround. Only adding the users one by one.
fields.summary: Allow automation rule action 'Alert user' to add groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40671].
  {panel}

Currently there is no way to temporarily disable a mail connection for SD mail handlers, which causes problems when a mailbox password expires or is changed.

When this happens, Jira continues polling the mailbox, which eventually locks the account. So even when we try to set the new password, it won't be accepted until the account is unlocked, which won't happen as the account continues to be locked.

The only option here is to either coordinate a time to manually unlock the mailbox and then update the password fast enough that Jira doesn't lock it again, or turn off the mail handler and set it back up after the mailbox auto-unlocks.

The problem with this workaround is that any messages received between the password expiration/change and when the new mail handler is created are ignored by Jira SD as it only looks at messages received after the mail handler was created.

In order for this to not continue to be a headache for us and our clients, one of the following solutions would be greatly appreciated:
1. Allow disabling a mail handler, without removing it entirely (as the "Turn off email requests" button currently does).
2. Allow us to control the "start date" that a SD mail handler processes for, so if we do have to recreate it at least we can capture older messages that are marked as Unread in the Inbox.
3. Allow us to force a password change in the settings so that eventually when the account is unlocked, the connection will work with the new credentials.
fields.summary: The ability to disable the Service Management mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an issue has a custom request type set and is moved to a sub-task, the custom request type is removed in the UI but still shows up in JQL searches.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Management project called 'ABC'
# Create a Request type in ABC called 'A' and set the Issue type to 'Task'
# Create an issue called 'Task' with the issue type 'Task' and with no 'Request type' set.
# Create another issue called 'Sub Task' with the issue type 'Task'
# Open the issue 'Sub-task' and manually set the request type set to 'A'
# Convert the 'Sub-task' issue by clicking on the' More' menu > 'Convert to sub-task'
# Take the following steps to convert it to a sub-task:
## Select the parent issue as being the issue 'Task' I created earlier. Click 'Next >>'
## A note pops up stating that "Step 2 is not required." Click 'Next >>'
## A summary appears saying that the type for this issue will be changed from 'Task' to 'Sub-task'. Click 'Finish'
# The issue now has the 'Request type' set to 'No match', and the issue is now a sub-task of my 'Task' issue
# Start a JQL query search with the following:
{code}project = ABC AND "Customer Request Type" = "A (ABC)"{code}
# In the list observe the 'Task' issue (which has the 'Request type' set to 'A'), and the 'Sub-task' issue (which has no 'Request type' set) both in the list returned by the query.

h3. Expected Results
Since the request type is removed from the 'Sub-task' issue when it is moved to become a sub-task, it should not show up in the list.

h3. Actual Results
The 'sub-task' issue shows up in the list.
Please note: running a re-index does not correct the results of the JQL.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL searches for a request type will return issues that don't match the query

h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you insert large queries into the *If* component of an Automation rule provided by Jira Service Management, the *Confirm* button will not be displayed under some circumstances, such as:

* You will not be able to find the button due to scrolling issues.
* JQL suggestions will be displayed over the button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the *Jira Administration Icon* > *Projects*.
# Select the correct project.
# Click on the *Automation section* at the *Project settings* page.
# Click on the *Add rule* button.
# For the *WHEN* section, select *Issue created*.
# For the *IF* section, select *Issue matches* and insert a JQL query as large as the one below:
{noformat}
status in (Open, "In Progress", Reopened, Resolved, Closed, "To Do", Done, Declined, "Waiting for support", "Awaiting implementation", "Peer review / change manager approval", "Under investigation", "Under review") AND priority in (Highest, High, Medium, Low, Lowest, Blocker) AND reporter in (user001, test, user002, currentUser()) AND "Customer Request Type"  IN ("Desktop/Laptop support",  "Fix an account problem (TS)", "Fix an account problem (TS)", "Get a guest wifi account (TS)") AND affectedVersion is not EMPTY   
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Jira Service Management will be able to display the confirm button as expected.

h3. Actual Results

You are not able to scroll down to locate the *Confirm* button.

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-21 at 14.00.59.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing a protocol for an email channel from IMAP to POP on an existing mail box with emails that already have been processed by IMAP email channel, requests (created by emails processed previously by IMAP) get duplicated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. create an email channel, configured with IMAP
2. create few customer requests using the email configured above
3. switch the protocol of an email channel from IMAP to POP3 **without clearing the mailbox**
4. wait for the inbox to get processed

h3. Expected Results

No duplicate tickets are created.

h3. Actual Results

Emails that were used to create tickets and were picked up by IMAP channel already are picked up by POP channel again and same tickets are created again.

h3. Workaround

Remove all emails from the inbox - either to a different folder or delete them completely, before switching IMAP to POP.
fields.summary: Changing email channel protocol from IMAP to POP creates duplicate requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Request Resolved* customer notification is not sent to the customer if the "Customer facing" status doest not change during the transition that resolves the request

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a new JSD project
# Edit any Request Type configuration in *Project Settings > Request Types* (for example "IT Help")
# Open the tab *Workflow Statuses*
# For each status configure the "Status name to show customer" to match "Workflow status in Jira", except for "In Progress": for this status only, set the customer facing status to "Resolved".
#- (!) With such configuration 2 customer facing statuses ("In Progress" and "Resolved") are configured with the same status "Resolved":
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
# Raise a new Request from the customer portal, using the Request Type configured in the previous step
# Open this request from the Jira UI (Agent view), and transition the status to "In Progress"
# View this request from the customer portal and note that the customer facing status shows as "Resolved", as expected
# Verify that the customer receives a *Customer-visible status changed* notification saying that the status was changed to "Resolved", as expected
# Go back to the agent view, and transition the ticket from "In progress" to "resolved"
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
# View this request from the customer portal and note that the customer facing status is still "Resolved" (no change), but the Resolution field is now set:
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 
# Now, check if the customer received any customer notification


h3. Expected

- The customer should not receive the *Customer-visible status changed* notification, since the customer facing status has not changed.
- However, the customer should receive the *Request Resolved* notification, since the resolution field was set during the transition


h3. Actual Results

The customer did not receive any notification.

Running the following SQL query is the proof that Service Desk did not sent the Notification of type *Resolved*
{code}
SELECT * FROM "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" sd
join jiraissue ji on ji.id=sd."ISSUE_ID"
join project pr on ji.project=pr.id
join app_user app on app.id=sd."RECIPIENT_ID"	
where pr.pkey = 'ABC' and ji.issuenum = 123;
{code}

 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Make sure that the customer facing statuses change during the transition going from "In progress" to "Resolved"
 !Step5.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The "Request Resolved" notification is not sent to the customer if the "Customer facing" status doest not change in the transition that resolves the request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a new language is added to the page *Project Settings > Language Support*, and if some translation is added to the help center announcement banner subject/message and the project specific announcement banner subject/message, it will become impossible for the project admin to edit the announcement banner of the help center page.

h3. Environment

The bug was replicated on JSD 4.11.0, JSD 4.13.0 and JSD 4.14.0.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a new JSD project on JSD 8.11.0 (or any higher version)
# Go to the main help center URL <JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals
# Click on *Customize*, add something to *Announcement subject* and *Announcement message*, and save the changes
# Note that the *Announcement subject* and *Announcement message* fields are properly updated even after a refresh of the page
# Click on the JSD project key under *Popular* to access the project portal page located at <JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portal/1
# Click on *Edit Announcement*, add something to *Announcement subject* and *Announcement message*, and save the changes
# Note that the *Announcement subject* and *Announcement message* fields are properly updated even after a refresh of the page
# Now, go to the JSD project configuration and go to *Project Settings > Language Support*
# Add a new language, for example, Nederlands
# Click on the Nederlands language, and add a translation to everything, especially all the fields in the *Announcements* section
# Go back to the *Language Support Dashboard* page, and notice that the status is up to date.
# Turn on the option *Available to customers* for the Nederlands language
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the main help center URL <JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals, and take note of the current announcement subject/message
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on *Customize*, modify both the to *Announcement subject* and *Announcement message*, and save the changes
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 
# After you save the result, you'll see that the changes are reflected
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 
# Refresh the main help center page
# Notice that the *Announcement subject* and *Announcement message* fields are reverted back to what they were
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 

Here is a video showing exactly how to replicate the bug:
 [^Screen Recording 8.14.0.mov] 

h3. Workaround

Update announcement subject/message as per [Customer portal announcement failed to be updated|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/customer-portal-announcement-failed-to-be-updated-1077911418.html]
fields.summary: The announcement banner subject and message of the main help center page can't be edited after adding new languages

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

If an incoming mail is used to add a comment to an existing ticket, this mail fails to be processed by the Service Desk Mail Handler if it has an attachment of size bigger than 10 MB with the error:
{code}
Unexpected error while running action as user...
{code}

h3. Steps to replicate

- Install Jira 8.13.0 with JSD 4.13.0
- Create a new Service Desk project
- Configure a mail handler in the JSD project in *Project Settings > Email Requests*
- Create a new request in the JSD project via the customer portal
- Now, send a new email to the JSD Mail Handler by making sure:
-- To include the issue key of the request created earlier in the subject (so that a new comment can be added to the existing request)
-- That the sender of this email is the same as the reporter of the request created earlier (so that this user has the right to add a comment to this request)
-- To include an attachment of size greater than 10 MB
- Wait for about 5 minutes for the Mail Handler to process this email (due to the large size of the email)


h3. Actual Results
- Go to the JSD Email Request Audit Log, and observe that the mail failed to be processed with the following error:
 !ErrorReproducedLocally.png|thumbnail! 
- Check the Jira incoming mail logs, and observe the following error:
{code}
2020-11-26 11:06:18,638+0100 ERROR [] Caesium-1-3 anonymous     Exception when MailHandlerWorker handles message: 
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unexpected error while running action as user 'julien'
	at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.util.runner.AuthenticationContextUtilImpl.runAs(AuthenticationContextUtilImpl.java:57) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.IncomingEmailServiceImpl.inEmailContext(IncomingEmailServiceImpl.java:504) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.IncomingEmailServiceImpl.lambda$doCreateNewOrCommentOnIssueWithMailChannel$15(IncomingEmailServiceImpl.java:185) [?:?]
	...

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot format given Object as a Number
	at java.text.NumberFormat.format(NumberFormat.java:248) [?:1.8.0_121]
	at java.text.Format.format(Format.java:157) [?:1.8.0_121]
	at java.text.MessageFormat.subformat(MessageFormat.java:1262) [?:1.8.0_121]
	at java.text.MessageFormat.format(MessageFormat.java:865) [?:1.8.0_121]
	at java.text.Format.format(Format.java:157) [?:1.8.0_121]
	at com.atlassian.jira.i18n.BackingI18n.formatI18nMsg(BackingI18n.java:251) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.i18n.BackingI18n.getText(BackingI18n.java:159) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.comment.InternalServiceDeskCommentErrors.buildDisplayedAttachmentBlockWithParam(InternalServiceDeskCommentErrors.java:167) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.comment.InternalServiceDeskCommentErrors.getAttachmentFailedMessages(InternalServiceDeskCommentErrors.java:144) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.comment.AttachmentValidatorImpl.validateMailAttachmentsToAdd(AttachmentValidatorImpl.java:233) [?:?]
{code}


h3. Expected results

A comment should be added
- with the attachment if the attachment size is less than 10MB
- without the attachment if the attachment size is more than 10MB

h3. Note

The error is not replicated when sending an email to *create a new issue* (instead of sending an email to add a comment to an existing issue). In such case, the request is successfully created, but without the attachment:
 !EmailSentToCreateNewIssue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira 8.13.0
JSD 4.13.0

h3. Workaround

The workaround consists in increasing the attachment size limit in the file {{<JIRA_HOME>/jira-config.properties}}, so that the mail handler can accept attachments of size bigger than the default coded limit 10MB.
Note that the unit is in bytes, therefore, to set the limit to 20MB for example, the value to be set is 20971520.

Detailed steps below to change the limit to 20MB for example:
- Edit the file <JIRA_HOME>/jira-config.properties as per [this kb|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/edit-the-jira-config-properties-file-in-jira-server-317194938.html] by adding the following parameter:
{code}
webwork.multipart.maxSize = 20971520
{code}
- Re-start Jira
fields.summary: [Service Desk Mail Handler] - Mails with attachments of size bigger than 10 MB fail to be added as comments of existing requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Change Start date" and "Change Completion date" fields in Jira Service Desk have no Search Template set when first installing JSD to Jira. As a result they don't show as fields in the issue searching menu and don't respond to jql autofill. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "Change" event in Jira Service Desk and add Change Start Date and Change Completion date fields.
 # Go to Search for Issues and look for the fields under the "more" dropdown - they don't show.
 # Under advanced search, try to add the fields into the jql: they don't show up under autocomplete and are invalid jql.

h3. Expected Results

The "Change start date" and "Change completion date" would have search template set to "Date Time Range picker" by default.
h3. Actual Results

The Change start date and Change completion date aren't searchable by default.
h3. Workaround
 # Navigate to the admin issues tab and select "Custom Fields" from the side menu.
 # Search for "Change" to bring up the Change Start Date and Change Completion Date in the list.
 # Select "edit" from the cog icon beside each field to edit the Search Template.
 # Select "Date Time Range picker" from the dropdown menu for Search Template.
 # After completing this step for both fields, Reindex Jira.
fields.summary: Change start date and change completion date are not searchable by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add a field to a Service Desk request type and later remove that issue type from the field context, it will prevent those request types from loading in the customer portal.

It's not known which field types this does and doesn't apply to, but we are not able to reproduce the same issue with text fields but are with Select List (Single Choice) and Select List (Multiple Choice) fields.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "Select List (Single Choice)" custom field 
 # Associate it with a Service Desk project and all issues types
 # Add this field to a request type in that Service Desk project
 # Test loading the customer request form and see that it loads properly and includes your new field
 # Go to the custom field page and click *Configure*
 # Click *Edit Configuration*
 # Remove the issue type for the above request type from the "Issue types" list (i.e., select any random other issue type)
 # Again try to load your customer request form. If you load the URL directly, it will now be a blank page. If you load the portal for that project and click the link, it will appear to soft refresh but nothing will load.
 # This may also affect Custom Fields without any associated projects in the context, regardless of the associated request type

h3. Expected Results

The request page loads properly.
h3. Actual Results

The page fails to load. If you attempt to load the URL directly, you will get a blank screen. If you click the link to the request from the portal, you will see a 500 error on {{/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models}}.

The following error is found in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code:java}
2020-11-19 15:21:40,720-0600 http-nio-48131-exec-7 ERROR uname 921x668x1 mlgopn 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/1/create/1 [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/j8131].[default]] Servlet.service() for servlet [default] threw exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.SelectCFType.getDefaultValue(SelectCFType.java:223)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.fields.optionsprovider.SelectOptionsProvider.getDefaultValues(SelectOptionsProvider.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.fields.optionsprovider.SelectOptionsProvider.apply(SelectOptionsProvider.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.fields.ServiceDeskJIRAFieldServiceImpl$OptionsProvidersFunction.lambda$apply$1(ServiceDeskJIRAFieldServiceImpl.java:366)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:175)
...
{code}
h3. Notes
 * *It also happens with other custom fields of multiple options. e.g. checkboxes, radio button;*
 * It does happen with all the custom fields types.
 * The log entry for the error will variate if the custom field comes from an external plugin.
 * The Saf-mode doesn't stop the problem when the custom field is from a plugin.

h3. Workaround

There are two known workarounds at this time:
 * Remove the field from the request type screen
 * Change the context for the custom field to include the issue type of that request type

Refer to the KB article [500 error when trying to create a request from the Service Management Customer Portal|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/500-error-when-trying-to-create-a-request-from-the-service-management-customer-portal-1085195236.html] for more detailed information about the workaround.

h3. Suggestions

1. The system should give the user a warning or ask for confirmation before applying the modifications, in order to avoid accidental changes that could lead to this scenario.
 2. The Jira Integrity Checker could find that and fix it, or at least point the need of fixing it to the Jira admins.
fields.summary: Removing the issue type context for a Service Desk field can break Request Types where it's in use

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira is configured and LDAP directory ranked first in the directory list, various Service Desk functionalities fail to work whenever the LDAP directory is temporarily unavailable and throw a confusing error "Signup is not currently available".

Some examples of functionalities that are impacted are listed below:
- Incoming Mails are rejected from new customers, even if the Service Desk portal is configured with "Public Signup" enabled
- New customers can't signup on the customer portal and no message is thrown in the UI (already tracked in the bug: JSDSERVER-5791)
- New customers can't be created by using the Service Desk API and an incorrect message is returned

h3. Environment

Reproduced in JSD 4.4.2, 4.13.1, but this issue was probably there in older JSD versions (3.x).

h3. Steps to reproduce

- Install a new Jira application
- Create a new Service Desk project
- Configure the Service Desk project with *Public signup* enabled
- Configure a mail handler in the Service Desk project via *Project Settings > Email Requests*
- Configure an LDAP directory in *⚙ > User Management > User Directories*, with *Read/Write*
- Rank this LDAP Directory above Jira's Internal Directory
- Make the LDAP server temporarily unavailable from Jira, for example by stop the LDAP Server
- Try each the 3 actions below
- *Action 1*
-- Send an email to the Service Desk Mail handler from an email address which is not associated to any Jira user
- *Action 2*
-- Open the Service Desk customer portal (and don't sign in yet)
-- Click the link *Sign up for an account*
-- Try to create an account using an email address which is not associated to any Jira user
-- Click the *sign up* button
- *Action 3*
-- Open Postman or any other API tool
-- Try to create a new customer using an email address which is not associated to any Jira user
{code}
POST: <JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/servicedeskapi/customer
body:
{
    "email": "test@test.com",
    "fullName": "test@test.com"
}
{code}


h3. Actual Results

*Action 1*

The incoming mail is rejected by the Mail handler and therefore lost, even though the Project is configured with Public Sign up:
{code}
Signup is not currently available
{code}

 !Action1_Issue.png|thumbnail! 

*Action 2*

Nothing happens when clicking the *Sign up* button, and no message is thrown in the UI. When using the Browser Dev Tool to analyze the HTTP response, the following message is returned with error code 400, even though the Project is configured with Public Sign up:
{code}
Signup is not currently available
{code}

 !Action2_Issue.png|thumbnail! 

*Action 3*

The API returns the following message with error code 400, even though the Project is configured with Public Sign up:
{code}
Signup is not currently available
{code}

 !Action3_Issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results

*Action 1*

- The error message should be changed to something like:
{code}Failed to create a new account from the email address due to the LDAP server being unavailable{code}
- Ideally, the email should be temporarily labeled in the JSD Database as "temporary failure", and the JSD Mail handler should try to process the same email a few more times before completely dropping it

*Action 2*

The UI should display a clear message indicating why the *sign up* button is not working, something like:
{code}The signup functionality is temporary unavailable. Please try again later{code}

*Action 3*

A different message should be returned from the API call, something like:
{code}Failed to create a new account from the email address due to the LDAP server being unavailable{code}
fields.summary: Some Service Desk functionalities not working as expected when Jira is connected to an LDAP server that's temporarily not reachable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to configure a JSD project mailbox using OAuth2 the following error message is received:

{noformat}OAuth token not defined for connection. OAuth Authorisation required{noformat}

In the application logs the following message can be observed in relation to the above error:

{noformat}2020-11-13 09:06:42,158+0000 http-nio-8186-exec-8 ERROR de3124 546x57162x1 1n0hrdk 10.131.19.21,192.168.0.2 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/FTP/incomingemail/oauth/validateandsaveflow/df31abb6-3ebc-4c4c-8947-47e92a9a85c0 [c.a.s.i.rest.emailchannel.EmailChannelResource] Failed to validate and save token: jep.mail.connection.verifier.missing.folder.error : 'JIRA couldn't open the folder 'inbox' at outlook.office365.com. Check and make sure the folder name is correct and try again.'{noformat}

The cause of the problem is that Jira is unable to find a folder named "inbox" in the target IMAP account. Jira is currently hard-coded to look for the folder by the name "inbox" in the target IMAP account, and if the account does not have this folder, or if the account was originally created in non-English language and thus has inbox folder named something like "Posteingang", Jira won't be able to find it by name.

If the account was created in non-English language, and the language pack was applied to rename all folders to English language, the underlying folder names would still be in the original language and the action of looking up the folder by name will fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Microsoft Exchange mailbox in German language
 # Try connecting to its mailbox from JSD project settings.

h3. Expected Results

Since the folder with the type INBOX exists, JSD should be able to locate it.

h3. Actual Results

JSD is unable to locate the Inbox folder.

h3. Workaround

To work around this problem, either create a folder named "Inbox", or if one already there, change the language setting of your mailbox to the original language, and then create a folder named "Inbox".
fields.summary: Attempting to configure a mailbox with no 'inbox' folder fails with message "OAuth token not defined for connection. OAuth Authorisation required"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Mail correspondence not stripped by mail handler when creating new comment.

This cannot be consistently reproduced, but it is related to different email clients and the differences in how they format text being used to strip quotes (see Notes section).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a Outlook / Exchange mail address
 # Set up a Email request channel with the created mailbox
 # Start creating tickets through emails and responding to received notifications, in order to add new comments on those tickets.

h3. Expected Results

The quoted correspondence is stripped and only the latest mail message is added to the comment.
h3. Actual Results

Previous mail correspondence is added to the comment, and this makes comments harder to read:
 !image-2020-11-11-14-32-16-197.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
h3. Notes from developers

The root cause lays in sending an Outlook Application message trough some other client, probably an online one, including Gmail, but it seems to affect outlooks own client right now.

The difference is in the standard of encoding text formatting by either ways: Outlook uses an approach called Quoted-printable while Gmail uses some other format. The difference is that the same email sent from outlook in raw Message protocol format wold look like
{code:java}
=20
From: Marko =20{code}
While sent from Gmail client looks like:
{code:java}
*From:* Marko{code}
Which is basically the same thing said in different ways, but we work with the raw message line-by-line.
 So the problem will occur ONLY when sending an outlook thread from another client to JSD mailbox (assuming that other client is using Gmail approach).
fields.summary: Mail correspondence not stripped by mail handler when creating new comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since JSD 4.9.0, the customer-portal search input-box placeholder text `What do you need help with?` has been moved to top of the input-box as a label, for better A11Y.

However, color of this label (specifically on the help-center page) does not change with the `Banner text` color customization, even though it is the foreground text in front of the customizable `Banner background` color or the customizable `Banner image`.

Being always in a dark-grey color, if customers' portal needs a `Banner background` color or `Banner image` that has very low contrast to it, the label becomes unreadable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As Jira admin, go to 'Customize' side panel on help-center page `/servicedesk/customer/portals?customize=true`
 # Set `#6b778c` as `Banner background` color OR upload a `Banner image` with color close to `#6b778c`

h3. Expected Results

`What do you need help with?` label on top of the input box should be readable.
h3. Actual Results

`What do you need help with?` label on top of the input box is barely (if at all) readable.
h3. Workaround

Add a CSS ruleset `.cv-help-center .sd-customer-portal-smart-search-label\{color: <banner-text-color> !important}` to
 * every CSS file containing existing `.sd-customer-portal-smart-search-label` selector; OR
 * the help-center page
fields.summary: `What do you need help with?` search input label color does not change with `Banner text` customization

The '*Return to queue*' option (or browser back button) when viewing a JSD issue returns you to the first page of the queue, instead of the previous page you were on prior to viewing the JSD issue.

This issue was introduced in JSD *4.7.0* and is not occurring in *4.6.11*.

 # Create 51 or more issues in JSD project
 # Go to second page of JSD queue

The user is returned to page 1 of the queue.
h3. Actual Results

The user should be returned to page 2 of the queue they were on before viewing the issue.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

h3. Issue Summary

When adding a custom provider lib for POP/SMTP custom providers as libs to Jira's WEB-INF/lib folder, accessing the E-mail requests project administration page of a JSD project and trying to add a new email configuration, an error message is shown saying that the provider could not be found, blocking the operation. The same issue is not present in Jira's incoming email configuration UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom provider example lib to Jira's WEB-INF/lib folder (attached to this ticket)

h3. Workaround

The developers of the plugin that notified us of the bug could work around the problem with the following strategy:
{quote}The workaround is to delete the javax.mail.Provider file, so the provider classes are no longer registered and those not instantiated. Instead, we use the old way of having a javamail.providers file in the Meta-Inf directory, which describes from where to load the store/transport classes directly, skipping the whole provider classes.
{quote}

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If Knowledge base has special character like (é ,etc) in Heading. When we try searching Knowledge base in Portal using the keyword which includes special character. Knowledge base is searchable. However, when we navigate back to Search after reading the article, by clicking on 'Back to results', the special character in the search result is converted '%C3%A9'

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Knowledgebase Article with heading: Védéo
# Login to Portal and try to search for the KB using the keyword: Védéo
# Open the Article and then click on 'Back to results'
# Search field is updated with keyword: V%C3%A9d%C3%A9o and this causes the zero search result.
# Attached is a Screen recording

h3. Expected Results
When clicked on 'back to result', it should not replace the special character and the previous search result should show

h3. Actual Results
When clicked on 'back to result', special character in search field is updated with %C3%A9

h3. Workaround
Click on back button in Web-browser will display the same character and result, rather than clicking on 'back to result'.
fields.summary: Portal - Knowledgebase - Character encoding issue in Search field

After upgrading Jira Service Desk from 4.5.1 to JSD 4.11.1 release, the select list custom field options are truncated in customer portal.

The long text option should be wrapped like JSD 4.5.1:

h3. Actual Results
The long text option is truncated in JSD 4.11.1:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 9.56.33 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
N/A

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Since many of our customers do see some issues that have broken SLAs specially if they run into performance issues, It might be useful to add functionality to do a health check on issue SLAs and identify which issues have broken SLAs that have invalid SLA event dates or corrupted values.
This should make the usage of the the REST API /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sla/admin/task/destructive/reconstruct much easier instead of reconstructing issues in bulk.
fields.summary: Need to introduce health check functionality to find broken SLAs that need reconstruction

fields.description:
'Language Support' in Jira is not translating the 'Select List (single choice)' field search message: "no matches found"

STEPS TO REPRODUCE
Create a custom field: "Test Field 1" with type: Select List (single choice)
Add the field to a Service Desk Screen:
Add the field to Request type: Get IT help
Click on 'Language Support' and add a language and select the field to be translated
Login using a customer account to Portal, set the same language set in customer profile
When trying to raise a Ticket with request type: "Get IT help". We could see that the Custom field is translated however, when we try to search for item which is not present, it throws a message: "no matches found". 
This message is not translated. Please find the attachment.

Jira version: 8.12.1 JSD 4.12.1
fields.summary: Multi-language: "Select List (single choice)" field message, not translated
